intro: Chabertia grandicorona, commonly known as the large-crown chabertia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound umbels of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats.
